definition: healthy/to invigorate/to strengthen/to be good at/to be strong in

sentences.english: About 70% of the population is in sub-health state.
sentences.chinese: 人羣中約有70%的人處於亞健康狀態。

sentences.english: The idea of "treating before illness" in it embodies nowadays sub-health theory.
sentences.chinese: 其“治未病”的思想即是現代醫學中的亞健康理論。

sentences.english: She is a doctor specialized in sub-health.
sentences.chinese: 她是專門研究亞健康的醫生。

sentences.english: You'd better have a sub-health test.
sentences.chinese: 你最好去做一下亞健康測試。

sentences.english: Regulation of the endocrine, balance hormones, improve sub-health, anti-aging.
sentences.chinese: 調節內分泌，平衡荷爾蒙，改善亞健康，延緩衰老。

sentences.english: Iam sure he is in a sub-health state.
sentences.chinese: 我確信他處於亞健康狀態。

sentences.english: The sub-clinical state has a fairly strong social property.
sentences.chinese: 亞健康狀態具有很強的社會性。

sentences.english: I bought some books on sub-health.
sentences.chinese: 我買了幾本關於亞健康的書。

sentences.english: Inferior healthy person when choosing nutrient composition replenishers , what should be short of to fill what.
sentences.chinese: 亞健康者選擇營養成分補充劑時，應缺什麼補什麼。

sentences.english: The protecting factor of sub-health was the decreasing of study pressure.
sentences.chinese: 亞健康狀態的保護因素爲學習壓力減小。

sentences.english: It is helpul to improve sleep and subhealthy .
sentences.chinese: 對改善睡眠和亞健康狀態效果均佳。

sentences.english: Conclusion Sub-health symptoms has high prevalence among undergraduates in Guangdong province.
sentences.chinese: 結論廣東省大學生普遍存在着亞健康的症狀。

sentences.english: Many of us don't know whether we are in a sub-health state or not.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不知道自己是否正處於亞健康狀態。

sentences.english: Most white cc, llcii-s are in sub-health states.
sentences.chinese: 大多數的白領處於亞健康狀態。
音樂對亞健康有治療作用。

sentences.english: Objective To explore quantization and evaluation method of sub-health state.
sentences.chinese: 目的探索亞健康狀態量化評價方法。

definition: Chinese and Western medicine/a doctor trained in Chinese and Western medicine
variant Chinese character/alternative form of a Chinese character
(TCM) interrogation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
